name: 1,2-Dichloro-Propane
Reason: The basic unit, propane, has a melting point of -187.7°C. Each chloro group in a compound elevates the melting point due to increased molecular weight and the resultant increased Van der Waals forces. A single chloro group can raise the melting point of a compound by approximately +45°C. Since there are two chloro groups in 1,2-dichloropropane, the total expected increase is about +90°C.
Test (Predicted reason):
- Basic unit, propane has a melting point of -187.7°C. 
- Each chloro group is electron-withdrawing and increases the polarity of the molecule, which can lead to stronger intermolecular forces such as dipole-dipole interactions. Each chloro group is expected to increase the melting point by approximately +40°C. 
- The presence of two chloro groups will have a cumulative effect on the melting point.
